name: Italian Asparagus and Mushroom Frittata
author: miche
summary: Frittata is a great breakfast or lunch dish and with asparagus and mushrooms, it's extra tasty. It is started on the stove and then finished in the oven. It also tastes good reheated the next day.
ingredients: ½ bunch asparagus, trimmed and cut into 1-inch pieces
salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
3 tablespoons freshly grated Parmesan cheese, divided
directions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Heat oil in an oven-safe skillet over medium heat and cook garlic until it starts to sizzle, about 1 minute
Add asparagus and mushrooms and cook until softened, 4 to 5 minutes
Season with salt and pour in white wine
Mix eggs, milk, 2 tablespoons Parmesan cheese, parsley, salt, and pepper in a bowl
Pour into the skillet over the asparagus and mushrooms
Cook until eggs start to set, about 3 minutes
Sprinkle with remaining 1 tablespoon Parmesan cheese and transfer to the oven
Bake in the preheated oven until frittata has risen and is set, about 20 minutes
